hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Altcoin Volatility Spike Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: During sustained NEUTRAL regimes (10+ days), when a mid-cap altcoin (e.g., AVAX, GRT) experiences a volatility spike (+40% daily move) driven by spot volume < 30% of total volume (indicating derivative-driven move), fading the move direction will be profitable as price reverts toward its 20-day VWAP within 3 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack sustained directional momentum. Extreme moves driven primarily by derivatives (low spot volume ratio) are often unsustainable and prone to rapid mean reversion as funding rates normalize and leverage flushes.
entry_conditions: Approved altcoin (AVAX, GRT, etc.) has |daily return| > 40%
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: High spot volume accompanies the move (>50% ratio) or price establishes new equilibrium away from VWAP.
